body: That's because ES2022 adds no new globals, and eslint has decided not to make a noop "env" for the years that don't add new globals. You'll need to get lucky and guess the latest year that does add new globals, and put that in your env.

Hi @ljharb, do you know how to config ESLint to validate ES2022 code then? It is quite confusing that they announced that they are supporting ES2022 since 8.0 in June last year but not very clear on how to set it up properly if they don't support ES2022 as a global env...
You set parserOptions.ecmaVersion to 2022. ‚Äúenv‚Äù is not the primary way to configure that.

> You set parserOptions.ecmaVersion to 2022. ‚Äúenv‚Äù is not the primary way to configure that.

It must be primary, or at least possible.
Bcos, it's very confusing and it affects **3rd-party** parsers in a very bad way, e.i.: `@babel/eslint-parser` ü•∂

Usage of `parserOptions.ecmaVersion` with it will end up in **eslint** to fallback to default ECMAScript **5** spec üòë
And as result many `globals` NOT available, at all üíÄ
Yes, the current way it works is that you always specify the ecmaVersion, and then also supply the available env keys. It works perfectly fine with Babel‚Äôs parser to do this.

I just clearly don't see the reason why I cannot simply add `globals.es2022 = true` and that's it üßê
I oughta be a way to make it work, coz it's quite some confusing API.
I agree it‚Äôs confusing that you have to just ‚Äúknow‚Äù which years add globals and which don‚Äôt - but that‚Äôs still the way it works.
(fwiw, I‚Äôve asked about this before - it‚Äôs incredibly confusing that every year isn‚Äôt present - https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/8453#issuecomment-293727708)

If someone‚Äôs willing to do the work (@bricss, would you be interested?), I wouldn‚Äôt be opposed to filling in the gaps between years since they‚Äôre effectively aliases to the prior year that does contain changes. It‚Äôs reasonable to me that we‚Äôd take on the work of understanding the precise differences between each version of the standard in order to offer consumers a friendlier API.
I‚Äôd be happy to make that PR; I‚Äôll look into it tonight.

issue.title: feat: add esN envs for all post-es6 years
